# **भारतीय दंड संहिता: हमला और आपराधिक बल से संबंधित धाराएँ**

# Title: **धारा 131: गंभीर उकसावे के अलावा हमला या आपराधिक बल के लिए दंड**

जो कोई किसी व्यक्ति पर गंभीर और अचानक उकसावे के अलावा हमला करता है या आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करता है,

उसे अधिकतम तीन माह तक के कारावास, या एक हजार रुपये तक के जुर्माने, या दोनों से दंडित किया जा सकता है।

## **स्पष्टीकरण 1:**

गंभीर और अचानक उकसावा, निम्नलिखित स्थितियों में इस धारा के अंतर्गत दंड को कम नहीं करेगा:
icl_document:
Physical altercations, even minor ones, can have legal consequences. If force is used unlawfully,
it may be punishable under the law.
document_outline:
This document outlines various legal provisions related to criminal force, explaining relevant statutes
through real-world scenarios. It aims to educate individuals on their rights and the legal consequences
of using force unlawfully.
icl_query_1: A man shoved a shopkeeper over pricing. The shopkeeper didn’t retaliate. Was the push illegal?
icl_response_1: Yes, this is an offense under Section 131, as force was used without grave provocation.
icl_query_2: My neighbor slapped me in a parking dispute. Can I take legal action?
icl_response_2: Yes, the slap is considered criminal force under Section 131, and legal action can be taken.
icl_query_3: At a wedding, my cousin threw a drink at another guest. Could this lead to legal trouble?
icl_response_3: Yes, this act falls under Section 131, as it constitutes criminal force.
icl_query_4: I pushed a pedestrian aside while cycling in frustration. Can I face legal trouble?
icl_response_4: Yes, using force in such a situation can be punishable under Section 131.
icl_query_5: My boss slapped my colleague for an error. Can my colleague file a complaint?
icl_response_5: Yes, under Section 131, the employer can be charged for using criminal force.
document_translated: # ** Indian Penal Code: Sections Relating to Assault and Criminal Force** # Title: **Section 131: Penalties for Assault or Criminal Force Other Than Serious Incitement** Whoever attacks or uses Criminal Force against a person other than Serious and Sudden Incitement may be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or a fine of up to Rs.
question: What is the punishment for using criminal force other than serious and sudden incitement, as outlined in Section 131 of the Indian Penal Code?
response: Whoever attacks or uses Criminal Force against a person other than Serious and Sudden Incitement may be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or a fine of up to Rs. [Specify the exact penalty in the response, as per the document].
question_translated: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 131 में उल्लिखित गंभीर और अचानक उत्प्रेरणा के अलावा आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करने की सजा क्या है?
response_translated: गंभीर और अचानक उत्तेजना के अलावा किसी अन्य व्यक्ति पर हमला करने या आपराधिक बल का उपयोग करने वाले व्यक्ति को तीन महीने तक की जेल या रु.

# Title: **धारा 131: गंभीर उकसावे के अलावा हमला या आपराधिक बल के लिए दंड**

## **स्पष्टीकरण 1:**

icl_document:
Public servants, such as police officers and government officials, perform duties involving law
enforcement. Using force against them is a criminal offense.
document_outline:
This document outlines various legal provisions related to criminal force, explaining relevant statutes
through real-world scenarios. It aims to educate individuals on their rights and the legal consequences
of using force unlawfully.
icl_query_1: I pushed a traffic policeman in anger and drove away. Did I commit a crime?
icl_response_1: Yes, under Section 132, assaulting a public servant on duty is punishable.
icl_query_2: A shopkeeper grabbed a municipal worker to stop stall removal. Is this legal?
icl_response_2: No, preventing a public servant from their duty using force is an offense under Section 132.
icl_query_3: People shoved a government officer at a rally. Can they be arrested?
icl_response_3: Yes, this is an offense under Section 132.
icl_query_4: My friend tried to stop officials from seizing his shop physically. Can he be punished?
icl_response_4: Yes, his actions violate Section 132 and are punishable.
icl_query_5: Protesters pushed security guards to enter a government office. Is this a crime?
icl_response_5: Yes, under Section 132, assaulting public servants on duty is a crime.
document_translated: # ** Indian Penal Code: Sections Relating to Assault and Criminal Force** # Title: **Section 131: Penalties for Assault or Criminal Force Other Than Serious Incitement** Whoever attacks or uses Criminal Force against a person other than Serious and Sudden Incitement may be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or a fine of up to Rs.
question: What is the punishment for using criminal force on a public servant, as mentioned in the document?
response: According to Section 132 of the Indian Penal Code, using criminal force against a public servant on duty can lead to imprisonment up to three months or a fine of up to Rs. 500.
question_translated: इस दस्तावेज में कहा गया है कि एक सार्वजनिक सेवक पर आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करने पर क्या दंड है?
response_translated: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 132 के अनुसार, कर्तव्य में कार्यरत एक सार्वजनिक सेवक के खिलाफ आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करने से तीन महीने तक की जेल या 500 रुपये तक का जुर्माना हो सकता है।

In some cases, force is used not to injure but to humiliate or degrade another person. The law

icl_query_1: A man tore a woman’s scarf during an argument to insult her. Can she take legal action?
icl_response_1: Yes, this falls under Section 133, as force was used with intent to dishonor.
icl_query_2: A group paraded a man through the village to embarrass him. Is this against the law?
icl_response_2: Yes, under Section 133, using force to dishonor someone is a criminal offense.
icl_query_3: Someone threw ink on a journalist to shame him. Is this considered a crime?
icl_response_3: Yes, this act falls under Section 133.

icl_response_4: Yes, under Section 133, this is an offense.
icl_query_5: A group dragged a man out of a meeting to embarrass him. Can he file a complaint?
icl_response_5: Yes, this is punishable under Section 133.

question: What is the punishment for using criminal force on a person who has not caused serious and sudden incitement?
response: According to Section 131 of the Indian Penal Code, if someone attacks or uses criminal force against a person who has not caused serious and sudden incitement, they may be punished with imprisonment up to three months or a fine of up to Rs. 500.
question_translated: किसी ऐसे व्यक्ति पर आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करने के लिए क्या दंड है जिसने गंभीर और अचानक उत्प्रेरणा नहीं पैदा की है?
response_translated: भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 131 के अनुसार, यदि किसी व्यक्ति पर हमला किया जाता है या किसी व्यक्ति के खिलाफ आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग किया जाता है जिसने गंभीर और अचानक उत्प्रेरणा नहीं की है, तो उसे तीन महीने तक की जेल या 500 रुपये तक का जुर्माना लगाया जा सकता है।

enforcement. Using force against them is a criminal offense.
document_outline:
This document outlines various legal provisions related to criminal force, explaining relevant statutes
through real-world scenarios. It aims to educate individuals on their rights and the legal consequences
of using force unlawfully.
icl_query_1: I pushed a traffic policeman in anger and drove away. Did I commit a crime?
icl_response_1: Yes, under Section 132, assaulting a public servant on duty is punishable.
icl_query_2: A shopkeeper grabbed a municipal worker to stop stall removal. Is this legal?
icl_response_2: No, preventing a public servant from their duty using force is an offense under Section 132.
icl_query_3: People shoved a government officer at a rally. Can they be arrested?
icl_response_3: Yes, this is an offense under Section 132.
icl_query_4: My friend tried to stop officials from seizing his shop physically. Can he be punished?
icl_response_4: Yes, his actions violate Section 132 and are punishable.
icl_query_5: Protesters pushed security guards to enter a government office. Is this a crime?
icl_response_5: Yes, under Section 132, assaulting public servants on duty is a crime.
document_translated: - (a) if the offender intentionally or with an excuse caused the incitement. - (b) If the incitement was done by a legal act or by a public servant in exercise of his legitimate rights. - (c) If the incitement was done in exercise of his legitimate right of private defence. ## ** Explanation 2:** It is a factual question of how serious and sudden the incitement was that the offence should be mitigated. ## ** Section 132: Attack or criminal force to prevent the public servant from performing his duty. ## **
question: What is the legal consequence of using force against a public servant while they are performing their duty, as described in Section 132 of this document?
response: According to Section 132, using force against a public servant while they are performing their duty is considered an offense.
question_translated: इस दस्तावेज की धारा 132 में वर्णित एक सार्वजनिक सेवक के खिलाफ अपने कर्तव्य का पालन करते समय बल का प्रयोग करने का कानूनी परिणाम क्या है?
response_translated: धारा 132 के अनुसार, जब कोई सार्वजनिक सेवक अपना कर्तव्य निभाते है तो उसके खिलाफ बल प्रयोग करना अपराध माना जाता है।

## **धारा 132: सार्वजनिक सेवक को कर्तव्य से रोकने के लिए हमला या आपराधिक बल**
icl_document:
Confining someone against their will is unlawful. If force is used to restrain or prevent a person
from moving freely, it can be legally punished.
document_outline:
This document outlines various legal provisions related to criminal force, explaining relevant statutes
through real-world scenarios. It aims to educate individuals on their rights and the legal consequences
of using force unlawfully.
icl_query_1: My landlord locked my brother inside his room over rent. Can we file a complaint?
icl_response_1: Yes, this is an offense under Section 135.
icl_query_2: A group physically blocked a man from leaving a meeting. Is this legal?
icl_response_2: No, this is wrongful confinement under Section 135.
icl_query_3: Mall security locked a customer in a room without reason. Can he take legal action?
icl_response_3: Yes, this falls under Section 135.
icl_query_4: A group blocked my sister from leaving a house by standing in her way. Is this a crime?
icl_response_4: Yes, under Section 135, wrongful confinement with force is a crime.
icl_query_5: Protesters locked a journalist inside a vehicle to stop reporting. Can this be reported?
icl_response_5: Yes, this act is punishable under Section 135.

उसे अधिकतम दो वर्ष तक के कारावास, या जुर्माने, या दोनों से दंडित किया जा सकता है।

## **धारा 133: किसी व्यक्ति को अपमानित करने के इरादे से हमला या आपराधिक बल**

जो कोई किसी व्यक्ति पर, उसे अपमानित करने की नीयत से,
icl_document:
Physical altercations, even minor ones, can have legal consequences. If force is used unlawfully,
it may be punishable under the law.
document_outline:
This document outlines various legal provisions related to criminal force, explaining relevant statutes
through real-world scenarios. It aims to educate individuals on their rights and the legal consequences
of using force unlawfully.
icl_query_1: A man shoved a shopkeeper over pricing. The shopkeeper didn’t retaliate. Was the push illegal?
icl_response_1: Yes, this is an offense under Section 131, as force was used without grave provocation.
icl_query_2: My neighbor slapped me in a parking dispute. Can I take legal action?
icl_response_2: Yes, the slap is considered criminal force under Section 131, and legal action can be taken.
icl_query_3: At a wedding, my cousin threw a drink at another guest. Could this lead to legal trouble?
icl_response_3: Yes, this act falls under Section 131, as it constitutes criminal force.
icl_query_4: I pushed a pedestrian aside while cycling in frustration. Can I face legal trouble?
icl_response_4: Yes, using force in such a situation can be punishable under Section 131.
icl_query_5: My boss slapped my colleague for an error. Can my colleague file a complaint?
icl_response_5: Yes, under Section 131, the employer can be charged for using criminal force.
document_translated: Any person who, in the performance of his duty as a public servant, or with the intention of preventing him from doing his duty, or as a result of his legitimate duty, attacks or uses criminal force may be punished with imprisonment of up to two years, or fine, or both. ## **Section 133: Attack or criminal force with the intention of insulting a person**
question: Can a person be punished for using criminal force with the intention of insulting another individual?
response: Yes, according to Section 133 of the Indian Penal Code, any person who attacks or uses criminal force on another person with the intent to insult or provoke them may be punished with imprisonment of up to two years, or fine, or both.
question_translated: क्या किसी व्यक्ति को दंडित किया जा सकता है कि उसने किसी अन्य व्यक्ति को अपमानित करने के इरादे से अपराधियों के साथ बल का प्रयोग किया हो?
response_translated: हां, भारतीय दंड संहिता की धारा 133 के अनुसार, किसी व्यक्ति को अपमानित करने या उकसाए जाने के इरादे से किसी अन्य व्यक्ति पर हमला करने या उसके खिलाफ आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करने वाले व्यक्ति को दो साल तक की जेल या जुर्माना या दोनों की सजा दी जा सकती है।

response: No, a person cannot be charged with assault under Section 133 if they use force to prevent someone from committing a theft. While using force to prevent a crime is generally not considered an assault, it may still be considered an abetment of crime or criminal intimidation, depending on the specific circumstances. However, Section 133 specifically deals with the use of force with the intention of insulting a person, and it does not apply to situations where force is used to prevent a crime.

question_translated: भारतीय दंड संहिता में उल्लिखित गंभीर और अचानक उकसावे पर आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करने के लिए अधिकतम दंड क्या है?
response_translated: गंभीर और अचानक प्रलोभन पर आपराधिक बल का प्रयोग करने के लिए अधिकतम दंड में 1,000 रुपये तक का जुर्माना या एक महीने तक की जेल या दोनों शामिल हैं।

icl_document:
Theft becomes more serious when force is used. If someone attempts to steal property another person
is carrying and uses force in the process, it is a criminal offense.
document_outline:
This document outlines various legal provisions related to criminal force, explaining relevant statutes
through real-world scenarios. It aims to educate individuals on their rights and the legal consequences
of using force unlawfully.
icl_query_1: A man snatched my aunt’s handbag and pushed her. What legal action can she take?
icl_response_1: This falls under Section 134, as force was used in an attempt to commit theft.
icl_query_2: Someone tried to grab my chain and hit me when I resisted. Is this a crime?
icl_response_2: Yes, this is an offense under Section 134.
icl_query_3: A thief grabbed a cash bag and punched a delivery boy who resisted. Can he be charged?
icl_response_3: Yes, this is a criminal offense under Section 134.
icl_query_4: Someone snatched a mobile phone at a festival using force. Can this be reported?
icl_response_4: Yes, this is an offense under Section 134.
icl_query_5: A thief shoved a vendor to take his money. Does this fall under any law?
icl_response_5: Yes, under Section 134, using force while attempting theft is a punishable crime.
document_translated: Anyone who attacks on serious and sudden provocation given by an individual or uses criminal force can be punished with a maximum of one month's ordinary imprisonment, or fine of up to Rs. 1,000, or both. question: What is the maximum punishment for using criminal force on someone who has provoked you or another individual?
response: The maximum punishment for using criminal force on someone who has provoked you or another individual is a fine of up to Rs. 1,000 or imprisonment for up to one month, or both.

icl_document:
Confining someone against their will is unlawful. If force is used to restrain or prevent a person
from moving freely, it can be legally punished.
document_outline:
This document outlines various legal provisions related to criminal force, explaining relevant statutes
through real-world scenarios. It aims to educate individuals on their rights and the legal consequences
of using force unlawfully.
icl_query_1: My landlord locked my brother inside his room over rent. Can we file a complaint?
icl_response_1: Yes, this is an offense under Section 135.
icl_query_2: A group physically blocked a man from leaving a meeting. Is this legal?
icl_response_2: No, this is wrongful confinement under Section 135.
icl_query_3: Mall security locked a customer in a room without reason. Can he take legal action?
icl_response_3: Yes, this falls under Section 135.
icl_query_4: A group blocked my sister from leaving a house by standing in her way. Is this a crime?
icl_response_4: Yes, under Section 135, wrongful confinement with force is a crime.
icl_query_5: Protesters locked a journalist inside a vehicle to stop reporting. Can this be reported?
icl_response_5: Yes, this act is punishable under Section 135.
